feed.title: Sean Codes
feed.subtitle: Hi! I'm a software developer in Chicago specializing in Web Development, Network programming, and 2D Game development.

entry.title: Codepen Floating Action Button
entry.content:
This is a pen for a floating action button using CSS. This could be done using the checkbox trick but I felt using JavaScript will make it flow better because the action button already required a bunch of CSS.

See the Pen Front End 25 - Material Design Floating Action Button by Sean Codes (@sean_codes) on CodePen.

I hope this helps you please let me know if you have any questions!
entry.summary: This is a pen for a floating action button using CSS. This could be done using the checkbox trick but I felt using JavaScript will make it flow better because the action button already required a bunch of CSS.

entry.title: Are you a programmer? How old are you?

link.title: Are you a programmer? How old are you?

entry.title: I want to use Xamarin for cross platform development. Isn’t wrapping web apps a little bit slow and doesn’t feel like a native app?

link.title: I want to use Xamarin for cross platform development. Isn't wrapping web apps a little bit slow and doesn't feel like a native app?

entry.content: JavaScript is pretty fast already and CSS can access the GPU. If you use the right tools and techniques you should not be able to tell the difference in a Web App and native.
entry.summary: JavaScript is pretty fast already and CSS can access the GPU. If you use the right tools and techniques you should not be able to tell the difference in a Web App and native.

entry.title: Which language do you prefer?
entry.content: Currently I have been hitting JavaScript pretty hard but I’m into PHP, Python, ColdFusion, C#. I think all languages are cool! :]
entry.summary: Currently I have been hitting JavaScript pretty hard but I’m into PHP, Python, ColdFusion, C#. I think all languages are cool! :]

entry.title: Where did you learn to use SQL?

link.title: Where did you learn to use SQL?

entry.content: Learned the basics of SQL from w3schools.com. What you learn from the basic tutorials can usually get you through just about anything. I did not get very good with it until using it everyday at work and asking lots of questions to people much more skilled than me.
entry.summary: Learned the basics of SQL from w3schools.com. What you learn from the basic tutorials can usually get you through just about anything. I did not get very good with it until using it everyday at work and asking lots of questions to people much more skilled than me.

entry.title: Just curious what is the specifications on your MacBook? Think of getting one for coding.

link.title: Just curious what is the specifications on your MacBook? Think of getting one for coding.

entry.content: I’m using an early 2011 17in MacBook Pro. Has the I7 2.2Ghz, 8GB DDR3, and a 258GB SSD. If you get an older one just throw a SSD and bump it up to 8GB and you will be solid! Anything younger than 2013 will be really good!
entry.summary: I’m using an early 2011 17in MacBook Pro. Has the I7 2.2Ghz, 8GB DDR3, and a 258GB SSD. If you get an older one just throw a SSD and bump it up to 8GB and you will be solid! Anything younger than 2013 will be really good!

entry.title: What software do I need to code? What’s the code editor you use?

link.title: What software do I need to code? What's the code editor you use?

entry.content: I use Sublime Text 3 at Work. Atom at Home. I also like Brackets
entry.summary: I use Sublime Text 3 at Work. Atom at Home. I also like Brackets

entry.title: Good morning Sean. I was wondering what programs do you use?

link.title: Good morning Sean. I was wondering what programs do you use?

entry.content: My favorites right now are Sublime Text 3, Heidi SQL, and Google Chrome!
entry.summary: My favorites right now are Sublime Text 3, Heidi SQL, and Google Chrome!

entry.title: I want to ask toy that OS (Operating System) do you use for coding Node.JS apps? I don’t know if windows is good.

link.title: I want to ask toy that OS (Operating System) do you use for coding Node.JS apps? I don't know if windows is good.

entry.content: I am typically under Windows 10 all day. I stick to Web based languages so the OS shouldn’t matter. Use git bash and do npm install devtool -g and run your node app using devtool myNodeApp.js. Pick any OS you like Linux, Windows, Mac I like Windows on desktop and Mac for mobile/laptop
entry.summary: I am typically under Windows 10 all day. I stick to Web based languages so the OS shouldn’t matter. Use git bash and do npm install devtool -g and run your node app using devtool myNodeApp.js. Pick any OS you like Linux, Windows, Mac I like Windows on desktop and Mac for mobile/laptop
